question: Characteristic of venous blood flow of lower limb in duplex Doppler is?
options:
A. Monophasic
B. Biphasic
C. Triphasic
D. Non phasic

question: Intensifying screen is used in extraoral radiograph to:
options:
A. Decrease radiation to patient
B. Increase contrast
C. Decrease contrast
D. Collimation

question: Empty Thecal sac sign in:
options:
A. Arachnoiditis
B. Tethered Cord syndrome
C. Veebral osteomyelitis
D. Discitis

question: Yellowish-brown staining of the IOPA dental X-ray film is due to:
options:
A. Immersion in fixer without washing
B. Increased temperature of developer
C. Increased exposure time
D. Drying away of the developer solution
answer: A. Immersion in fixer without washing

question: Consistent radiographs require:
options:
A. Long cone technique
B. Fixed kvp & mA
C. Automatic processing
D. Proper developing

question: Patient's cross-infection with sensor, in digital radiography/RVG is prevented by
options:
A. Cover with autoclaved cloth with each use
B. Wipe with ethyl alcohol in each patient
C. Clean with 5.25% sodium hypochlorite in each patient
D. Cover with impervious barrier

question: A 8 year old child presented with cough and fever since 15 days. On auscultation, decreased air entry was found on right side. A CXR was done and shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
options:
A. Consolidation
B. Abscess
C. Hydatid Cyst
D. Congenital. AV Malformation

question: 26 year old, 6 feet 4 inch male presented to the emergency depament with complaints of acute onset dysnea. On examination, he was tachypneic, other vitals were stable. A chest xray was done which shown the following pathology:
options:
A. Pneumothorax
B. Hydropnemo thorax
C. Massive pleural effusion
D. Pulmonary embolism

question: Which of the following is the least useful for diagnosis of Spondylolisthesis?
options:
A. CT
B. MR
C. X-ray lumbar spine- AP view
D. X-ray lumbar spine- Lateral view
answer: C. X-ray lumbar spine- AP view

question:
The skin of a patient undergoing radiotherapy will show
after 2 weeks?
options:
A. Erythema
B. Depigmentation
C. Radiation induced carcinomas
D. No change

question: Which of these is not a pa of catatonia?
options:
A. Akathisia
B. Ambivalence
C. Ambitendency
D. Akinesia

question: Radiation causes cell death by:
options:
A. Charring of nucleoproteins
B. Destroying their mitochondria
C. Ionization
D. Disruption of cytosol

question:
The principal reason for placing an aluminium filter in
the primary beam of radiation is to:
options:
A. Reduce exposure time
B. Decrease development time of the films
C. Reduce radiation to the skin of the patient
D. Obtain greater definition of the images of teeth
answer: C. Reduce radiation to the skin of the patient

question: Disadvantages of grids are:
options:
A. Skin exposure of patient
B. Increase exposure time
C. Doesn't improve image
D. Overall density of radiograph is increased

question:
Which film is used for caries detection? (or) Which film
is used for caries detection in children?
options:
A. D speed
B. E speed
C. B speed
D. F speed

question: The base of an X-ray film is composed of:
options:
A. Polyester
B. Gelatin
C. Nylon
D. Bromide

question: Patient with history of tachyarrhythmias is on implantable cardioveer defibrillator. He develops shock. Best method to know the position and integrity of ICD is:
options:
A. CECT
B. MRI
C. USG
D. Plain radiograph

question:
The single most effective method of reducing patient
somatic exposure when taking radiograph is to use:
options:
A. A lead apron
B. Speed E film
C. Added filtration
D. An open ended, shielded cone

question: If multiple myeloma is suspected in a patient's history and intraoral radiograph, which of the following radiographs should be taken to confirm the diagnosis?
options:
A. Lateral skull
B. Anterior posterior view
C. Lateral oblique
D. Posterior anterior view

question: Campbell's lines are seen in:
options:
A. Transorbital
B. Transpharyngeal
C. Occipitomental
D. Transcranial

question: Radiographs are of no help in the diagnosis of
options:
A. Cementoma
B. Subluxation teeth
C. Acute alveolar abscess
D. Impacted canines

question: Which of the following has a radiolucency closest to the dentin:
options:
A. ZOE
B. Calcium hydroxide
C. Silicophosphate
D. Gutta percha

question: Cementosis are commonly seen in:
options:
A. Females in maxilla
B. Females in mandible
C. Males in maxilla
D. Males in mandible

question: What is the most poable diagnosis based on the findings in the CT scan given below?
options:
A. Extradural hemorrhage
B. Subdural hamorrhage
C. Intracerebral hamorrhage
D. Subarachnoid hamorrhage

question: A patient who has been given tumoricidal dose of radiotherapy recently reports to dental clinic with painful carious exposed mandibular first molar with periapical abscess. The treatment of choice should be:
options:
A. Extraction of the offending tooth
B. Root canal treatment if possible
C. No treatment should be given
D. Incision and drainage of abscess
answer: B. Root canal treatment if possible

question: A patient with pain abdomen for 2 hours presents to the casualty and the following X-ray was obtained. What is the most likely diagnosis?
options:
A. Pneumoperitoneum
B. Subphrenic abscess
C. Pneumomediastinum
D. Amebic liver abscess

question: Which of the following statements about developing a dental radiograph is false?
options:
A. It involves chemically precipitating metallic silver
B. If it is too long, it results in an over dark radiograph
C. If high temperatures are used, it results in a fogged, over dark radiograph
D. It typically involves a developer containing sodium thiosulphate
answer: D. It typically involves a developer containing sodium thiosulphate

question: Reversal lines are characteristic on the radiograph of:
options:
A. Osteoma
B. Osteosarcoma
C. Epidermoid cyst
D. Paget's disease of bone

question: The darkening of radiograph X-ray depends on all except:
options:
A. Thickness of object
B. Quality and quantity of X-rays
C. Angulation cone
D. Velocity of electron emitted from cathode

question: Effect of radiation is:
options:
A. Cumulative
B. Fractionalized
C. Concentrated
D. Dependent on genetic make-up of individuals

question: In leukemia patient, post extraction bleeding doesn't stop because of:
options:
A. Increased leukocyte count
B. Increased Ca+ level in blood
C. Platelet disorder
D. Deficiency of clotting factors

question: The radiopacity that frequently obliterate the root apices of maxillary molars is
options:
A. Maxillary sinus
B. Palatine bone
C. Zygoma and Zygomatic process of Maxilla
D. Orbital process of Zygomatic bone
answer: C. Zygoma and Zygomatic process of Maxilla

question: Disadvantages of using a GRID during radiography is:
options:
A. Increased patient exposure due to more exposure time
B. Decreased exposure time
C. Increased secondary radiation fog to film
D. Reduces secondary radiation to film
answer: A. Increased patient exposure due to more exposure time

question: Radiation effect blood supply because of
options:
A. Anemia
B. Endarteritis of small blood vessels
C. Infection
D. All of the above
answer: B. Endarteritis of small blood vessels

question: Dead bone appears on a radiograph as:
options:
A. Radiolucent
B. Radio-opaque
C. Cotton wool appearance
D. Salt and pepper appearance

question: Which of the following resembles caries in radiographs?
options:
A. Zinc oxide eugenol
B. Zinc phosphate
C. GIC
D. Polymethyl methacnilate

question: Decay of enamel following radiotherapy is initiated due to:
options:
A. Decrease in salivary flow
B. Direct radiations contacting the enamel
C. Dessication of tooth structure
D. Hypocalcification and pitting of enamel

question: The bisecting angle technique is used to take
options:
A. Bitewing radiographs
B. Periapical radiographs
C. True occlusal radiographs of the mandible
D. None of the above

question: Radiolucencies of the jaw may be seen in:
options:
A. Multiple myeloma
B. Giant cell tumours
C. Hyperparathyroidism
D. All of the above

question:
In intraoral radiograph, patient radiation is decreased by
all except:
options:
A. High speed film
B. Intensifying screens
C. Lead apron
D. Decreasing kVp

question:
For maintaining parallelism between object the and
film, film is placed at a distance to avoid distortion what should be done:
options:
A. Increase target to object distance
B. Decrease target to object distance
C. Both of the above
D. None of the above
answer: A. Increase target to object distance

question: What is the function of filtration process while taking radiographs?
options:
A. Remove the short wavelength photons
B. Remove the portion of long wavelength photons
C. To increase the radiation dose to patient
D. To increase scatter of secondary radiation
answer: B. Remove the portion of long wavelength photons

question: In cephalometric radiography, the distance between the subject and the source of X-ray is
options:
A. 2 feet
B. 48 inches
C. 4.8 metres
D. 5 feet

question: There is <2 cm painful swelling responsive to salicylates, this is:
options:
A. Osteoma
B. Osteochondroma
C. Osteoid osteoma
D. Osteoblastoma

question:
The best radiographic view of temporomandibular joint
is given by:
options:
A. Transorbital view
B. Reverse Towne's view
C. Transpharyngeal
D. Panorex

question:
To localize a supernumerary or an impacted tooth and
determine its exact relationship to the other teeth, which of the following radiographs would be most effective?
options:
A. A periapical and an occlusal view
B. An occlusal view using a high angle
C. A panoramic radiograph
D. Two or more periapical views at different angles and an occlusal view
answer: D. Two or more periapical views at different angles and an occlusal view

question: Patient's cross infection with bite block of orthopantamograph machine is prevented by
options:
A. Cover with autoclaved cloth with each use
B. Using disposable bite blocks
C. Clean with 5.25% sodium hypochlorite in each patient
D. Cover with impervious barrier

question: Radio density can be increased by
options:
A. Decreasing MA
B. Decreasing kVp
C. Decreasing target film distance
D. Increasing target film distance

question: The maximum penetration among the following is seen with which ray:
options:
A. Alpha
B. Beta
C. Gamma
D. Electron Beam

question: Which type of laser is used in waterlase system?
options:
A. Argon laser
B. Diode Laser
C. Nd:YAG laser
D. YSGG Laser

question: Maximum recommended dose for dental X-ray operator in a week is
options:
A. 100 milliroentgen
B. 10 roentgen
C. 100 roentgen
D. 300 roentgen

question: Density of radiograph is affected by all, except:
options:
A. mA
B. kVp
C. Cone angulation
D. Thickness of object

question: Patient with carcinoma endometrium treated with pelvic external beam irradiation to whole pelvis. Which of the following organs is most radiosensitive in the pelvic region?
options:
A. Ovary
B. Vagina
C. Bladder
D. Rectum

question: Occluded submandibular salivary duct can be best observed by
options:
A. Palpation
B. Sialography
C. Occlusal X-ray
D. Thermography

question: Expansion of the contrast filled space in myelography is seen in:
options:
A. Intramedullary tumor
B. Intradural extramedullary tumor
C. Spinal dysraphism
D. Extradural tumor

question:
The speed with which the electrons travel from the
filament of cathode to the anode depends upon
options:
A. Potential difference between the two electrodes
B. Number of milliamperes in the tube circuit
C. Angle between the filament and target
D. Voltage of the filament
answer: A. Potential difference between the two electrodes

question: Which among the following is not a risk factor for contrast-induced nephropathy?
options:
A. Diabetic nephropathy
B. High osmolar agent
C. Obesity
D. Dehydration

question: Which type of radiation effect results in radiation induced thyroid cancer?
options:
A. Somatic
B. Genetic
C. Teratogenic
D. Autosomal

question: For a maxillary premolar in a radiograph, the facial root appears distal to the palatal root, the film was exposed with:
options:
A. Increased vertical angulation
B. Decreased vertical angulation
C. From mesial side of the tooth
D. From distal side of the tooth
answer: C. From mesial side of the tooth

question:
All of the following statements about an intraoral dental
X-ray film are true except:
options:
A. It is composed of a cellulose acetate base coated with a silver bromide emulsion
B. It has a thin sheet of lead foil that lies in front of the film to prevent overexposure
C. It has an embossed dot on it which should be orientated towards the source of X-rays
D. It is exposed by the direct action of X-rays on the emulsion
answer: B. It has a thin sheet of lead foil that lies in front of the film to prevent overexposure

question: Investigation of choice for a lesion of the temporal bone is
options:
A. X-ray
B. USG
C. CT
D. MRI

question: In an internal derangement of TMJ fracture, panoramic view has been taken for the patient. To confirm our diagnosis, we may take the help of
options:
A. MRI
B. CT scan
C. Arthroscopy
D. Bone scan

question: A 10 year old presented to ohopaedic OPD with a Curved Back, AP and Lateral Radiographs are obtained, what is the most likely cause of such deformity?
options:
A. Congenital
B. Neurofibromatosis
C. Idiopathic
D. Neuromuscular

question: Which of the following are most sensitive to X-ray?
options:
A. Tooth buds and salivary glands
B. Nerve and muscle tissue
C. Hair and nails
D. Cartilage
answer: A. Tooth buds and salivary glands

question: The best radiograph to obtain a view of maxillary sinus is:
options:
A. Lateral oblique maxilla
B. Submentovertex
C. Waters view
D. Lateral skull

question: Best noninvasive investigation to check for bility of myocardium is:
options:
A. FDG-18 PET CT
B. MIBG scintigraphy
C. Echocardiogram
D. Thallium scintigraphy

question: A middle aged female presents with slowly progressive weakness of lower limbs, spasticity and recent onset hesitancy of Micturition. On neurological examination there is evidence of dorsal myelopathy. MRI scan of spine reveals middorsal intradural contrast enhancing mass lesion. Diagnosis is:
options:
A. Intradural lipoma
B. Dermoid cyst
C. Meningioma
D. Epidermoid cyst

question: The usual radiographic appearance of an osteosarcoma is:
options:
A. Discrete radiolucency with regular borders
B. Multicystic radiolucency with a soap bubble appearance with an irregular peripheral border
C. Sunburst pattern with radiopaque strands extending from the cortical plates
D. Cotton wool appearance with an irregular peripheral border
answer: C. Sunburst pattern with radiopaque strands extending from the cortical plates

question: All of the following form radiolucent stones except:
options:
A. Xanthine
B. Cysteine
C. Allopurinol
D. Orotic acid
